Name: Pattern Recognition - IND
Text: Okay, I need to create a Log Skeleton for the order fulfillment process. Let's start by understanding each constraint and how they apply to the activities.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: First, Equivalence: If one activity happens, the other must happen the same number of times. Maybe RO and CA? Like when an order is received, it should have an availability check. But maybe there's no strict equivalence here except perhaps for paired steps like RI and PI if reservation and picking are always together. Hmm.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Always Before: Activities that must come before others. RO should be before all other activities. Then CA comes after RO but before RI since you can't reserve without checking availability first. Similarly, QC must happen after Pick Items (PI). Maybe GSL comes after PO because you need to pack the order before generating a shipping label.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Always After: This is less common. Maybe if an activity like Invoice Customer (IC) should always be processed after Dispatch (D), since you can't invoice until dispatch happens? That makes sense. So D -> IC and maybe RP follows IC?

Name: Hypothesis Generation - NE
Text: Never Together: There might not be any conflicting activities that can't co-occur in a case, but perhaps some parts of the process shouldn't happen at the same time. Maybe QC and PI can't overlap in a single case; you have to finish picking before quality check starts? But I'm not sure. If there are no such constraints, maybe this section is empty.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Activ Occurrences: Each activity's allowed counts. For example, RO should occur once per order (1). CA after RO (maybe 0 or 1 if some orders don't need availability checks?), but typically it would be exactly once. RI follows CA (again once), PI same as above. QC should happen after PI, so once. PO maybe once as well. GSL once after PO. Dispatch once per order. IC and RP could both occur once.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Directly Follows: If an activity happens, the next must follow immediately. RO  CA, CA  RI, RI  PI, PI  QC, QC  PO, PO  GSL, GSL  D, D  IC, IC  RP. Each step leads directly to the next without gaps.
